body:
Name pretty much explains it.


Comment how you got it.


My worst injury is a broken nose. I got a broken nose because my brother was making a bridge with his body and I went under him and he fell and slammed my head on my wood floor.

Name pretty much explains it.


Comment how you got it.

replies.body:
When i was like 10, I had the brilliant idea to try to walk up a hill of mulch on stilts......

I fell backwards and i used my left arm to break the fall.....literally......my arm was broken for months.......

I was a smart kid XD

replies.body:
I don't know which was worse.
First I had a firework explode in my face, which burned a lot of my hair and some of my skin. Also, at one point I was playing with my friend and we were messing around and he threw this piece of 4x4 wood at me, and since I was looking away, it landed on my head. Not a fun experience, I had to get 10 stitches.
replies.body_tagged:

Not a fun experience, I had to get 10 stitches.

replies.body:
when i was very little i accidentally fell into a pile of tiles, and i hit my head on the corner of one of them. Put a hole in my head xd i was bleeding so damn hard. They had to fill the hole with some glue. I still have the scar.
I can't remember any of it tho, that was just what my parents told me.

Eh, I was in an elevator when it failed. It dropped down three stories and smashed into the bottom. I broke my leg (my bone was protruding the skin) and suffered a concussion.

Another one would be falling about 20 metres onto cactus, then getting my ribs smashed by falling rocks.

Fun.

replies.body:
Well the worse that ever happened to me was getting my finger bones broken in multiple months consecutively due to accidentally bumping them against the walls of objects... imagine you running and then suddenly a MASSIVE spike of pain ignites from your hand.

You look down to see a dislocated pinkie that can barely move.

Another time, I was being chased by a girl who wanted to fight me when I accidentally bumped into her. (Said sorry)
This was in middle school and I was a lot less... robust and muscular... She was a walking tank is what I would describe her... a very angry tank... although I could defend myself pretty well, I didn't want to hit a girl otherwise I'd be the one in trouble...
She chased me all over the school until I made a misstep on some stairs and fell down. 

My thumb broke my fall :(((

This one is pretty recent... like 2 years ago...
I got a blister from sleeping on the floor... my leg was on the heater the whole night.
I developed it on my leg and I didn't know what it was and I freaked out. Never seen a blister before until that happened... hurrggghh... It was giant.

As soon as it made contact with a wall, it popped and I yelped in surprise and disgust... 
I developed cellulitis at the region... I nearly had my leg amputated. However, I was put on antibiotics in time and I was rescued.
replies.body_tagged:

replies.body:
Broke my arm when running down a hill backwards then tripped over landed left arm first at a very awkward angle. (Don't try at home kids)

Don't ask why i was running down hill backwards , i just was.
Still did school with a broken arm though (thought it was sprained) , until i realized it was actually broken.

replies.body:
Not sure if it was my worst injury but I feel like telling the story anyway.
I was playing rugby league with a few mates a few years back.

I got tackled and as I went down, I landed on someone's knee.
The guy was in the process of running so he basically kneed my head at full force as I went down.

I had a pretty big head on my bump after it..

replies.body:
Deven threw me off a slide in 5th grade and it broke my arm. The thing was turned 180 degrees so the 2 of us forcefully turned it back around. I went home, went to the hospital and it turns out that it was a few millimeters from breaking the growth plate.

fun

Also appendicitis. That was fun too

Im very clumsy.

replies.body:
I was once on my neighbor's trampoline and we playing a rough version of basketball (since you can basically only jump) and I was going for a dunk and he pushes me and I land and hit my front tooth on my knee.

It was knocked way out of place but after about a couple of weeks it got back in place. I still a little bump where I hit my tooth on my knee.

Funny thing is, my tooth was sort of crooked (I was going to get braces about 2 months after) and when I hit it and it went back in place, it was straight.

It's practically a dead tooth right now since I had to have oral surgery and have all the nerves taken out of it so it wouldn't get infected. But it looks fine, even with braces.
